intro: Jacquinia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and densely packed on its stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia ovalifolia is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions.
